com.ikalagaming.pathing

Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.pathing.Point
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Point>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PointSynchroinzed

    public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Point>, java.io.Serializable
    A point in 2d space. Not synchronized, and must be accessed in a thread-safe manner.
    Author:
    Ches Burks
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Point

        public Point()
        Creates a new point at (0, 0) with a level of 0. This is the equivalent of calling Point(0, 0, 0).
        See Also:
        Point(int, int, int)

      • Point

        public Point(int x,
             int y)
        Creates a new point at (x, y) with a level of 0. This is the equivalent of calling Point(x, y, 0).
        Parameters:
        x - The starting X position of the point.
        y - The starting Y position of the point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed coordinates are not valid.
        See Also:
        Point(int, int, int)

      • Point

        public Point(int x,
             int y,
             int level)
        Creates a new point at (x, y) with the supplied level.
        Parameters:
        x - The starting X position of the point.
        y - The starting Y position of the point.
        level - The starting level of the point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed coordinates or level are not valid.

    • Method Detail

      • synchronizedPoint

        public static Point synchronizedPoint(Point p)
        Returns a new synchronized (thread-safe) point backed by the specified object. In order to guarantee serial access, it is critical that all access to the backing point is accomplished through the returned collection.
        Failure to follow this advice may result in non-deterministic behavior.
        It is also suggested to create the new point in the call, such as synchronizedPoint(new Point(...)).
        Parameters:
        p - The point to be "wrapped" in a synchronized point.
        Returns:
        A synchronized view of the given point.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Point o)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Point>

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()
        Returns the level of the point. This will be between 0 and 32767, inclusive. It will be positive, since negative levels are not supported.
        Returns:
        The level of the point as an integer.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the X value of the point. This will be between -2147483648 and MAX_VALUE, inclusive.
        Returns:
        The x value as a signed int.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the Y value of the point. This will be between -2147483648 and MAX_VALUE, inclusive.
        Returns:
        The y value as a signed int.

      • init

        protected void init()
        Initializes members to default values. This exists so that it can be overridden in subclasses (namely, the synchronized wrapper class) so that variables can be ensured to exist before method calls.

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(int level)
        Sets the level of this point to the given number. Note that negative values are not supported.
        Parameters:
        level - the level to use.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the level is below 0 or above 32767.

      • setX

        public void setX(int x)
        Sets the X value of the point.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed value is below -2147483648 or above 2147483647.

      • setY

        public void setY(int y)
        Sets the Y value of the point.
        Parameters:
        y - The new y value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed value is below -2147483648 or above 2147483647.
